title: Dungeons and Dragons - Rolltables
description: A compendium of 5e compatible rolltables generated by ChatGPT.

campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| d20 Roll | Melee Attack Critical Failure |
|---|---|
| 1 |  Your attack misses entirely, and your momentum causes you to spin out of control, becoming prone. |
| 2 | Your weapon slips out of your hand and lands 10 feet away from you in a random direction. |
| 3 | Your miss gives your opponent an opening. They can make a reaction attack against you. |
| 4 | You lose your footing temporarily, your speed is reduced to 0 until your next turn. |
| 5 | You inadvertently hit an innocent bystander or ally (DM's choice) if there is one within your weapon's reach. |
| 6 | Your attack ricochets off an object and you take 1d4 bludgeoning damage. |
| 7 | You break your weapon on a nearby object, rendering it useless until repaired. |
| 8 | You knock yourself out with your own attack, you're stunned until the end of your next turn. |
| 9 | You overextend your attack. Your AC is reduced by 2 until your next turn as you're off balance. |
| 10 | Your attack throws you off balance. You cannot take reactions until your next turn. |
| 11 | You drop your guard while trying to regain balance, granting advantage to the next attack against you. |
| 12 | In your attack's follow through, you expose a weak point. Your opponent gets a bonus to damage on their next successful hit. |
| 13 | You overexert yourself in the attack and suffer 1 level of exhaustion. |
| 14 | Your weapon becomes lodged in a nearby object, requiring a strength check to free it. |
| 15 | Your attack's powerful recoil causes you to suffer 1d6 strain damage. |
| 16 | Your hand cramps from the misfire, you have disadvantage on your next attack roll. |
| 17 | You leave yourself wide open. The next attack against you is made with advantage. |
| 18 | Your weapon's weight shifts unexpectedly, damaging your wrist. You take 1d4 damage. |
| 19 | Your failed swing puts you off balance. You can't take bonus actions until your next turn. |
| 20 | Your weapon slips out of your grip and hits you, dealing its base damage to you. |

## Ranged
| D20 Roll | Ranged Attack Mishap |
| -------- | --------------------- |
| 1 | Your weapon snaps under the force of the draw, it is now useless |
| 2 | You misjudge the pull and the projectile shoots straight up. Next round it could fall on your head unless you move |
| 3 | Your weapon slips out of your hand on release, and is flung 15 feet in a random direction |
| 4 | Your shot goes wide and hits an unseen object, ricocheting back in your direction. You must make a DC12 Dexterity save to avoid getting hit by your own attack | 
| 5 | You accidentally shoot a companion next to you. Roll attack roll against your ally's AC |
| 6 | The string on your bow snaps in your face. You are blinded until the end of your next turn |
| 7	| The shot shakes you off balance. Your movement speed is halved next round |
| 8	| The shot goes wild and hits an unintended object causing a ruckus. Any stealth is now broken |
| 9	| The shot goes incredibly wide and wastes additional ammunition |
| 10 | You pull a muscle in your hand, you have disadvantage on attacks with this weapon until you have a short rest |
| 11 | You misjudge your stance, stumbling forward 5 feet |
| 12 | The weapon backfires causing an ear splitting noise, you are deafened until the end of your next round |
| 13 | The ammunition used is damaged and shatters on release, causing you to take 1d4 slashing damage |
| 14 | Your ammunition is lodged in your weapon, it will take an action to remove and the weapon cannot be used until it is |
| 15 | You underestimate the strength needed and the shot falls flat at your feet |
| 16 | Your weapon becomes caught in your clothing and you are unable to move until you use an action to free yourself |
| 17 | You pull too hard on the string and it wraps around your wrist. The weapon is stuck to your hand until you use an action to free it |
| 18 | Your attack goes off at an awkward angle and you twist your wrist. You take 1d4 damage |
| 19 | The shot is caught by the wind and veers wildly off course, possibly alerting unintended creatures to your presence |
| 20 | You manage to nick your hand on the draw, causing you to lose concentration on any spells or abilities you were maintaining |

## Arcane
| D20 Roll | Mishap Due to a Critical Failure on an Arcane Attack |
|----------|------------------------------------------------------|
| 1 | Your spell backfires and you take the full damage instead of the intended target. |
| 2 | A surge of wild magic throws you 10 feet in a random direction. Roll a d8 for direction (1 is north, and then clockwise). |
| 3 | Your spell causes an unintended side effect. An extra dimensional entity is temporarily summoned and it is hostile. |
| 4 | The magic within you is temporarily drained. You cannot cast spells until you complete a long rest. |
| 5 | Your spell affects a random target within range (DM's choice). |
| 6 | Your spell rebounds towards you, roll against your own spell resistance. |
| 7 | A phantom effect mimics your spell but no damage is dealt to the target. |
| 8 | The energy of your spell is too powerful and engulfs you, causing you to faint until the start of your next turn. |
| 9 | You accidentally open a minor gate to another plane of existence. An unexpected creature or object drops out. |
| 10 | You are cloaked in a shimmering light, becoming a target. All enemies now focus their attention on you. |
| 11 | Your spellcasting component or focus explodes from the raw magic, rendering it useless. |
| 12 | The spell fails to cast but you still lose the spell slot. |
| 13 | A blinding flash strikes your eyes. You are blinded until the end of your next turn. |
| 14 | Instead of the intended spell effect, adhesive substances spring from your hands. You are restrained for 1d4 rounds. |
| 15 | Your spell words get mixed up, casting a random spell from your list on a random target within range. |
| 16 | Instead of attacking, your spell heals the target for the same amount of HP the attack might have caused. |
| 17 | You become the target of your own spell, experiencing its full effect. |
| 18 | Your magic fizzles out in an embarrassing way, causing nearby allies to lose confidence in your abilities. |
| 19 | You are momentarily frozen in shock from the feedback of magic. You skip your next turn. |
| 20 | A miscalculation in your spell's power causes an explosion dealing 2d6 damage to everyone within 10 feet. |

## Melee
| d20 Roll | Boon from a Critical Melee Attack |
| -------- | ------------------------------- |
| 1 | Your attack hits with such force it sends the enemy sprawling. They must spend their movement to stand next turn. |
| 2 | Your attack hits a vital organ. The enemy suffers an additional 1d6 damage per turn until they are healed. |
| 3 | A surge of adrenaline grants you advantage on your next attack. |
| 4 | Your confident attack intimidates nearby enemies reducing their attack bonuses by 1 for their next turn. |
| 5 | The force of your attack knocks the enemy's weapon from their grip. It lands 10 feet away. |
| 6 | Your hit breaks through the enemy's defensive stance, giving your allies advantage on attacks against them until your next turn. |
| 7 | Your critical hit scares the enemy, making them flee until they can make a successful Wisdom save against your attack roll. |
| 8 | Your precise attack removes any damage resistances or immunities the enemy may have for the next round. |
| 9 | Your attack creates an opening for an ally. They can immediately make one weapon attack as a reaction. |
| 10 | Your exceptional hit increases the critical hit range of your next attack by 1. |
| 11 | You sense a weakness in your enemy's defenses. Your next attack against them has advantage. |
| 12 | The power behind your attack is so immense it knocks the enemy back 10 feet and they fall prone. |
| 13 | Your attack is so fast it catches your enemy by surprise, leaving them stunned until the end of their next turn. |
| 14 | The enemy drops any item they were holding due to the force of your hit. |
| 15 | Your strike is so harrowing that the enemy becomes frightened of you until the end of their next turn. |
| 16 | The enemy is marked by your powerful attack, making them a clear target. Your allies get +2 on attack rolls against them until your next turn. |
| 17 | You strike a nerve cluster, paralyzing the enemy until the end of their next turn. |
| 18 | You shatter your enemy's confidence, reducing their damage by half on their next successful attack. |
| 19 | In a dazzling display of skill, you gain one extra attack on your next turn. |
| 20 | Your attack releases a shockwave that knocks nearby enemies prone. |

## Ranged
**D20 Rolltable: Boons due to a Critical Success on a Ranged Attack**

| D20 Roll | Result                           |
|----------|----------------------------------|
| 1        | Arrow hits a vital organ, doubling the damage. |
| 2        | Arrow penetrates enemy weapon, disarming them. |
| 3        | Shot disorients enemy, they lose their next turn. |
| 4        | Arrow pins enemy's foot, reducing movement speed by half. |
| 5        | Enemy loses sight from dust or debris, granting advantage on the next attack. |
| 6        | Missile disturbs the enemy's belt, causing them to drop a random item. |
| 7        | Bolt pierces through the enemy into a second target, dealing halved damage to both. |
| 8        | Arrow struck the enemy's hand, imposing disadvantage on their next attack. |
| 9        | Successful shot encourages your allies, granting them +1 to their next attack rolls. |
| 10       | Skilled shot intimidates enemies, forcing a morale check. |
| 11       | Arrow shatters upon impact causing enemy to take an additional 1d4 piercing damage. |
| 12       | Wind gusts aid your shot, allowing a second attack on different target in range. |
| 13       | Shot disrupts enemy's casting, forcing a concentration check on spells. |
| 14       | Arrow hits enemy's magic focus, disabling magic use until retrieved. |
| 15       | Skillful shot severs enemy's sentimental keepsake, instilling fear and doubt. |
| 16       | Projectile bounces off enemy onto nearby environmental hazard, triggering it. |
| 17       | Shot grazes enemy's forehead, blinding them for their next turn. |
| 18       | The exceptional hit bolsters your confidence, granting advantage on next attack roll. |
| 19       | Arrow pierces enemy's bag of gold, scattering coins and distracting enemies. |
| 20       | Perfect shot lands in enemy's mouth, blocking all verbal spells. |

## Arcane
| d20 Roll | Arcane Attack Boon |
|---|---|
| 1 | Your attack resonates with the weave of magic, causing your spellcasting ability modifier to double for your next spell. |
| 2 | The power of your attack leaves an arcane mark on your enemy that gives you advantage on your next spell attack against them. |
| 3 | The enemy blasted by your spell is pushed 10 feet away in a direction of your choice. |
| 4 | You tap into the raw source of magic, enabling you to cast your next cantrip without expending a spell slot in the next minute. |
| 5 | Your spell creates an array of mesmerizing lights, temporarily blinding the enemy until the end of their next turn. |
| 6 | Your successful attack sends a ripple through the magical weave granting you +2 AC for the next round. |
| 7 | For a moment, time seems to slow; you can immediately take a bonus action. |
| 8 | Your spell vibrates in harmony with your arcane focus—causing it to recover one expended spell slot of up to 3rd level. |
| 9 | Your sparkling display of magic attracts the attention of a nearby magical creature who is now friendly towards you. |
| 10 | You feel a sudden surge of arcane energy and regain hit points equal to the spell's level. |
| 11 | The enemy hit by your spell takes an extra 1d6 force damage from the lingering arcane spectral energy. |
| 12 | You channel the excess power into your defenses, gaining resistance to a type of damage of your choice until your next turn. |
| 13 | Your spell shines a vivid, mesmerizing color. Any enemy who sees it is frightened until the end of their next turn. |
| 14 | Sheer arcane power courses through you. Your Spell Save DC increases by 2 for your next spell. |
| 15 | The enemies affected by your spell have disadvantage on their next saving throw against your spells. |
| 16 | The shock of your attack disrupts the magical energies around you. The next spell cast by a creature other than you within 30 feet fails. |
| 17 | Arcane runes appear around your enemy. The next attack against them by any creature is made with advantage. |
| 18 | A wall of force appears in front of you. It provides three-quarters cover until your next turn. |
| 19 | A duplicate of your spell ripples into existence, targeting a second enemy within range. |
| 20 | The raw power of your spellcasting transforms the battlefield. Choose one point of terrain within 30 feet. It becomes difficult terrain for your enemies until the end of your next turn. |

## Aarakocra
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Thalon | A scarred, no-nonsense Aarakocra warrior, always seen with his trusted spear. |
| 2 | Krell | A high-flying Aarakocra scout. His feathers are charred, evidence of his close calls with danger. |
| 3 | Orilam | A watchful sentinel, no detail escapes from his sharp, hawk-like eyes. |
| 4 | Heilaka | A stern character, she is the tribe's lead healer and master of herbal knowledge. |
| 5 | Poshku | A grim gatherer, known for his uncannily accurate foraging skills. |
| 6 | Eleleth | Reputed scholar, spends her time studying ancient texts and ruins. |
| 7 | Tulk | A meticulous blacksmith, his metalwork is as precise as it is durable. |
| 8 | Ylka | A young, serious Aarakocra ranger. She tracks threats with relentless resolve. |
| 9 | Nym | A deeply religious leader, known for his solemn rituals and stern leadership. |
| 10 | Vylri | A cold-blooded assassin, her steely eyes and sharp talons spark fear in many hearts. |
| 11 | Qen | A decorated war veteran, stern and staunch in his dedication to the tribe's protection. |
| 12 | Rel | A devoted druid, he communicates with nature regularly, and treats his duties with utmost seriousness. |
| 13 | Ienkil | An honest and hard-working trader, known for her intricate handcrafts. |
| 14 | Serku | A stern scribe, meticulously documenting the history and knowledge of his tribe. |
| 15 | Wyn | A mysterious seer, her cryptic prophecies direct the future of the tribe. |
| 16 | Xylka | A doting caretaker, looking after the young with a serious yet tender touch. |
| 17 | Zelik | An accomplished enchanter, his magic items are known for their astonishing precision. |
| 18 | Olu | A no-frills cook, known for simple yet nourishing meals. |
| 19 | Abi | A disciplined hunter, who trains his eagle companion with strict precision. |
| 20 | Ura | A revered elder, her wisdom is a guiding beacon for the tribe. |

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Irael | A solemn Aasimar cleric dedicated to maintaining order and peace; her silver-grey eyes radiate calm and serenity. |
| 2 | Thamior | A stoic Aasimar paladin whose unwavering sense of justice is evident in his golden armor and crimson cape. |
| 3 | Elyon | A highly disciplined Aasimar monk with spiritual tattoos covering his arms. His gaze is intense, indicating a deep level of focus and determination. |
| 4 | Maurel | This Aasimar ranger frequents the wilds, his glowing, blue-eyed gaze always scanning the horizon. He is quiet, seemingly more comfortable amongst animals than people. |
| 5 | Vaella | A driven Aasimar wizard whose thirst for knowledge is insatiable. She wears complex spectacles, her golden hair tied back as she constantly pours over ancient tomes. |
| 6 | Jophiel | A wise Aasimar fighter, his love for strategy and tactics is as evident as the scars criss-crossing beneath his soft celestial glow.|
| 7 | Zaphkiel | Zaphkiel serves as a humble Aasimar cleric, her healing skills as renowned as her empathic nature. She has a patient and caring demeanor, with a soft halo illuminating her compassionate face. |
| 8 | Uriel | An Aasimar bard who composes solemn songs and epic poems. His music echoes both his celestial heritage and his quest for truth and enlightenment. |
| 9 | Lenael | Lenael guards nature’s sacred spaces as a stoic Aasimar druid. Her silvery hair and leafy garments mirror the tranquility of the forests she protects. |
| 10 | Seraphiel | An Aasimar monk, Seraphiel has secluded himself in a mountaintop monastery, to better understand the celestial essence within him. His stillness radiates an ethereal calm. |
| 11 | Hadriel | An insightful Aasimar warlock who made a pact with a celestial being. His presence is unsettling yet awe-inspiring, as though he vibrates at a different frequency. |
| 12 | Raguel | A steadfast Aasimar paladin, rumored to have smitten down a hundred fiends single-handedly. His imposing armor shimmers with celestial energy. |
| 13 | Ramiel | An enigmatic Aasimar wizard specializing in divination. Even when still, he seems to reach out into the weave of magic that envelops the universe. |
| 14 | Raphael | A hardy Aasimar fighter who uses his celestial strength to protect the innocents. His gauntlets often glow with divine energy when he clenches them to intervene. |
| 15 | Saraqael | A versatile Aasimar bard skilled at manipulating both social situations and the raw forces of the arcane. Her lilting songs resonate with a celestial harmony. |
| 16 | Uriel | A protective Aasimar ranger who watches over borderlands and frontiers. His eyes hold the steady gaze of one used to long vigils in the wilderness. |
| 17 | Selaphiel | A disciplined Aasimar monk who strives to balance her martial prowess with spiritual growth. She is usually cloaked in serene silence. |
| 18 | Israfel | An independent Aasimar rogue who trusts in her celestial intuition as much as her deft hands. She moves like a shadow, her passage marked only by a soft, silver glow. |
| 19 | Cassiel | A scholarly Aasimar cleric, known for his pursuit of ancient knowledge. His aura resonates with the divine energy that constantly swirls around him. |
| 20 | Azrael | A forgone Aasimar paladin on a solitary quest for retribution. Dark feathers are woven into his graying hair, and his eyes harbor a determined remorse. |

## Bugbear
| Dice Value | Name         | Description |
|------------|--------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1          | Grulg        | An intimidating and skilful bugbear hunter, muscular and covered in battle scars. Fiercely loyal to his tribe. |
| 2          | Tharg        | A bugbear shaman with coal-black fur. Though he has an imposing presence, he speaks rarely and softly.  |
| 3          | Snort        | A burly bugbear with a broken tusk and a gruff demeanor. Known for his outstanding strength. |
| 4          | Varg         | A bugbear chieftain with fur scarred by burn marks. A brutal and ruthless leader, respected and feared by his tribe. |
| 5          | Blarg        | An elder bugbear whose fur has started to grey. Highly revered for his wisdom and storytelling. |
| 6          | Srag         | A bugbear scout with deep-set eyes and a lithe figure. Notorious for his stealth and tracking skills. |
| 7          | Phrug        | A bugbear warrior defined by a white streak in his fur. Known for his fearlessness in battle. |
| 8          | Gort         | A veteran bugbear sergeant with matted fur and numerous battle scars. Commands respect due to his long years of service. |
| 9          | Flask        | A bugbear brewmaster, stout from testing his own concoctions. Seen as eccentric within the community, but appreciated for his craft. |
| 10         | Ulg          | A bugbear artist with delicate hands. His intricate cave paintings bring a semblance of culture and beauty to the tribe. |
| 11         | Slog         | A bugbear brute who serves as the tribe's enforcer. He is feared for his explosive temper and unpredictable behavior. |
| 12         | Frug         | A female bugbear shamaness. Her eyes emit an eerie glow, hinting at her potent magical prowess. |
| 13         | Zorg         | A disfigured bugbear warrior. His physical prowess remains despite his prominent limp. |
| 14         | Gurt         | A recluse bugbear herbalist. His understanding of the forest plants around him have made him an essential part of the tribe. |
| 15         | Harg         | A bugbear thief. Nimble and stealthy, he is often accused of stealing food from the communal stores. |
| 16         | Prug         | An old bugbear, the tribes' record keeper. His memory serves as the living history of his people. |
| 17         | Drool        | A bugbear hunter known for his deadly accuracy with a spear. His targets rarely escape. |
| 18         | Skrag        | A bugbear blacksmith with powerful arms. His craftsmanship is highly valued and sought after. |
| 19         | Brug         | A bugbear fisher. His knowledge of the local rivers and lakes is key to the survival of his tribe. |
| 20         | Klorth       | A bugbear elder and peacekeeper. His fair judgement and negotiation skills maintain harmony within the tribe. |

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Ephemera | A solemn changeling with pale shifting eyes. They often adopt the form of a renowned scholar, deepening their understanding of the world through continual study. |
| 2 | Mirage | A determined changeling who prefers to assume the form of royals and nobles. Their goal is to spread prosperity and justice, though their means are highly unorthodox. |
| 3 | Vestige | A reserved changeling, usually mimicking the appearance of skilled warriors. Although they never speak of their past, their scarred body tells a tale of countless battles. |
| 4 | Phantasm | An introspective changeling who spends most of their time as a traveling bard. Despite being in the spotlight, they manage to keep their true identity hidden. |
| 5 | Effigy | A vigilant changeling who prefers the guise of a ranger. They use their camouflaging skills to protect the wilderness and its creatures from harm. |
| 6 | Lacuna | A mysterious changeling who often takes the form of elusive thieves. Their motivations are unknown, but they seem to be driven by some personal vendetta. |
| 7 | Cadence | A disciplined changeling who mostly appears as a disciplined monk. They carry themselves with grace and seem devoted to a life of contemplation and peace. |
| 8 | Riddle | A secretive changeling tending to adopt the appearances of wise oracles. They are poised and always seem to speak in enigmatic metaphors. |
| 9 | Illusion | A stoic changeling typically assuming the form of a solemn cleric. They are always ready to lend a helping hand, seeking to heal both physical and mental wounds. |
| 10 | Figment | A shrewd changeling favoring the form of cunning rogues. They are quick to use their shape-shifting ability for personal gain, always one step ahead of their pursuers. |
| 11 | Mirage | A calm changeling who mostly appears as a serene druid. They have an innate bond with nature and the creatures that inhabit it. |
| 12 | Chimera | An ambitious changeling who often takes the form of influential nobles. Their charm and charisma enable them to navigate the political landscape with ease. |
| 13 | Echo | A melancholic changeling who frequently adopts the appearance of wandering minstrels. Their songs are bittersweet, always leaving listeners touched. |
| 14 | Specter | A daring changeling, typically taking the form of brave knights. Their courage and commitment to justice have earned them respect among many circles. |
| 15 | Veil | A compassionate changeling who prefers the guise of gentle healers. The care they provide seems to reach deeper than just physical wounds. |
| 16 | Doppelganger | An unpredictable changeling assuming forms of various adventurers. They live for thrill, always ready to join any journey, no matter how dangerous. |
| 17 | Fragment | A wise changeling who often takes the form of scholars and sages. They seek knowledge above all, often sharing their wisdom with eager listeners. |
| 18 | Quicksilver | A nimble changeling who usually appears as agile acrobats. Their swift maneuvers and playful behavior can captivate any crowd. |
| 19 | Mirage | A composed changeling typically seen as court jesters. Behind their playful acts and jests, something deeply thoughtful seems to dwell. |
| 20 | Paradox | A resourceful changeling who often adopts the shape of diffident librarians. Hidden behind a façade of timidity, they harbor a depth of understanding and insight. |

## Dragon
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Pyrrhus, the Stoic | Pyrrhus is a fiercely effective brass dragon adorned with ancient war marks and scars, a testament to his solitary nature and propensity for defense over flight. |
| 2 | Ezelynn the Sage | Ezelynn is a time-worn silver dragon with a vast trove of knowledge about the magic arts and immortal beings, her stoic manner conceals a heart that is kind but tragically lonely. |
| 3 | Xorn the Last | Xorn is a bronze dragon and the last of his bloodline. With a majestic presence and a palpable aura of solitude, he is stoic, with a sense of duty that borders on martyrdom. |
| 4 | Ghazan the Endbringer | A massive gold dragon, Ghazan emits an aura of dread and finality, his somber gaze reflective of all the lives he has ended in pursuit of what he concludes to be the greater good. |
| 5 | Marsalok the Guardian | Marsalok is a steadfast green dragon known to act as a protector of wild lands from encroaching civilizations, his countenance is stern and unyielding to intruders. |
| 6 | Zyr the Unseen | Zyr, a shadow dragon filled with a bitter, calculating intellect, and known for manipulating events behind the scenes, speaks in dark, enigmatic riddles. |
| 7 | Orastrum the Timeless | Orastrum is an ageless copper dragon, known for her dispassionate observation of time's ebb and flow, and for wisdom gleaned from countless epochs experienced firsthand. |
| 8 | Ignomoth the Stoic | Ignomoth is a large red dragon with hardened scales from countless battles, he's stern, seldom speaking unless it warrants, and emits an awe-inspiring aura. |
| 9 | Setherix the Wise | Setherix is an old silver dragon, eternally meditative, and is reputed for his counsel, providing wisdom only if deemed worthy. |
| 10 | Korgos the Ironscale | Dwarfing most dragons, Korgos the black dragon is stoic and fearsome. His stillness speaks volumes of his discipline and battle-ready mindset. |
| 11 | Vorastrix the Silent | Vorastrix is a white Dragon of myth, known for fierce battles and stoic silence. He only converses with those he thinks are worthy. |
| 12 | Fersyth the Sentinel | This impenetrable bronze dragon Fersyth guards valuable treasures and powerful artifacts with a stoic commitment that is both impressive and terrifying. |
| 13 | Xirven the Immutable | Xirven, a blue dragon, watches over desert dominions with a stern gaze and a will that defies the shifting sands, a creature of determination and unyielding spirit. |
| 14 | Olyndar the Holder of Secrets | Olyndar, a secretly admired green dragon, is a cryptic keeper of hidden truths and forbidden knowledge that he guards with a stringent and unwavering will. |
| 15 | Morhyth the Inevitable  | A silver dragon, Morhyth’s presence symbolizes impending doom or vast change, standing as the stoic grim reaper of destinies and unchangeable fates. |
| 16 | Vyserion the Watchful | Vyserion, a blue dragon holds a patient, vigilant watch over the mortal realm with a stern gaze and an unwavering sense of duty. |
| 17 | Taishyl the Unyielding | A copper dragon, Taishyl stands boldly in the face of adversity, never breaking stance nor abandoning his steadfast principles. |
| 18 | Skeltheraz the Grey Watcher | Skeltheraz, an ancient grey dragon is a lonesome guardian of forgotten civilizations and lost eras, a stoic preservationist of time’s passing.  |
| 19 | Halethrix the Unmoved | This black dragon, Halethrix remains ever stoic and impassive, remaining undisturbed by the world's changing moods and whims. |
| 20 | Hestruvius the Solitary | Hestruvius, a silver dragon, spends eons in solitude. Silent and ponderous, he stands as a testament to the endurance of the draconian spirit. |

## Dragonborn
| Dice Value | Name              | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|------------|-------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1          | Thava             | A female dragonborn with scales as black as obsidian. She has a stillness about her that betrays no emotion. Serves as a respected war strategist.                                                                                          |
| 2          | Morgran           | A hulking male Dragonborn with brilliant blue scales and sharp, calculating eyes. An esteemed Guard Captain often seen patrolling the city streets.                                                                                        |
| 3          | Heskan            | A male red-scaled dragonborn, known for his fiery demeanor and piercing look. A popular blacksmith who takes his craft very seriously.                                                                                                      |
| 4          | Ghesh             | A large, stoic dragonborn with storm-grey scales. He is the town's seasoned cleric and upholds the dragonborn code of honor with unwavering commitment.                                                                                    |
| 5          | Valmurg           | An aging dragonborn scholar with green dragon ancestry, reflected in his emerald-hued scales. Renowned for his dedication to preserving ancient dragonborn lore.                                                                           |
| 6          | Enna              | A striking dragonborn with silver scales, often seen studying the night sky with a calm, serious expression. Serves the city as a highly revered astronomer.                                                                               |
| 7          | Paxan             | Paxan is an older, stern male dragonborn with bronze scales showing signs of age. As the tavern owner, he is known for his no-nonsense attitude and insistence on following the law to the letter.                                         |
| 8          | Azan              | A yellow-scaled, slippery-eyed male dragonborn. As a merchant dealing in exotic goods, he always maintains a straight face during transactions, able to bluff even the sharpest of customers.                                              |
| 9          | Bharash           | A dragonborn of white hue, respected in his town for his contributions to safeguarding it from threats as a seasoned ranger. Known for his stoicism and unflappable demeanor.                                                             |
| 10         | Yrindra           | A powerful, regal female dragonborn with gold scales. Highly respected as the city magistrate, she is renowned for her fairness and precision in all legal matters.                                                                         |
| 11         | Darragon          | Male dragonborn with obsidian black scales. His calm yet imposing presence is known throughout, where he serves as the silent, solemn undertaker.                                                                                          |
| 12         | Quarethon         | A dragonborn of Topaz scales. A watchful, sun-hued eyes vigilant city guard, who shows no mercy to those who disrupt the peace.                                                                                                            |
| 13         | Verthisathurgiesh | An ancient dragonborn sage, with deep grey craggy scales. Known for his vast wisdom and critical approach, spends most of his time in his extensive home-library.                                                                           |
| 14         | Faerlara          | A respected dragonborn healer with sapphire scales and serene demeanor. Despite her quiet, serious air, she is deeply compassionate, working tirelessly to tend to the sick and injured.                                                   |
| 15         | Corrinn           | A silver-scaled dragonborn diplomat known for her eloquent speeches and impartial decision-making. Her stern and unbiased approach in settling disputes has earned her great respect.                                                     |
